title: 112_s1484
content: The Act titled "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits taxpayer-funded abortions and provides conscience protections by amending Title 1 of the United States Code to include a new chapter on these issues. The "Hyde and Related Amendments Codification Act" prohibits federal funding for abortions and health benefit plans that cover abortion. It also includes provisions on the use of non-Federal funds for health coverage, treatment of abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother, and non-preemption of other Federal laws. It also restricts the use of Federal funds for health coverage that includes abortion services. Federal facilities and employees are prohibited from providing abortion services. Individuals, entities, or states can purchase separate abortion coverage using non-Federal funds. Non-Federal funds can be used for abortion coverage as long as it does not involve matching funds from federally subsidized programs like Medicaid.
